meanings.sent1: She would often pish at his silly jokes.
meanings.sent2: Please don't pish at my ideas without listening first.
meanings.sent3: When she heard the ridiculous suggestion, she couldn't help but pish in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: His refusal to consider any other options made her pish in frustration.
meanings.sent5: The way he pished at her suggestions made her feel unappreciated.

meanings.sent1: Don't believe everything you hear; some of it is just pish.
meanings.sent2: The article was full of pish, with no real facts to back it up.
meanings.sent3: The excuse he gave was pure pish, and nobody believed him.
meanings.sent4: His explanation sounded like complete pish to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The pish he was spouting made everyone roll their eyes.

meanings.definition: A sound of contempt or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: She made a dismissive pish when he suggested a silly idea.
meanings.sent2: The audience's collective pish could be heard when the speaker made a ridiculous claim.
meanings.sent3: His constant pish during the meeting annoyed everyone present.
meanings.sent4: The pish from the back of the room indicated the audience's lack of interest.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's pish clearly showed her frustration with the disruptive students.
